Articles.Content:
One of the issues I have with the rovemate probe is that the orientation actually points up.

If I cannot rebuild the rover, are there other ways to orient it so that it face forward or backward?

6 minutes ago, Jestersage said:

 

If I cannot rebuild the rover, are there other ways to orient it so that it face forward or backward?

None that I'm aware of. I usually end adding a small probe oriented in the direction of travel and controlling from there.

Edited October 27, 2016 by Kermanzooming
I know words. I have the best words.
Stick a Clamp-O-Tron Jr. on the front, and "control from here" on it.

28 minutes ago, Jestersage said:

One of the issues I have with the rovemate probe is that the orientation actually points up.

I actually think this has to be a bug, and that at some point someone at Squad will go 'wait a minute now...'; one would expect a probe that is clearly designed for rovers and to be placed in a specific orientation, would have the control/navball properly aligned for surface travel.

 

30 minutes ago, Jestersage said:

If I cannot rebuild the rover, are there other ways to orient it so that it face forward or backward?

The obvious workaround would be to add an additional small probe core, or probably easier a surface-attachable Jr docking port, with the correct orientation 'forward', and either re-root to that, or in flight right click and select 'control from here'.
